Emotion.title: Emotion
Emotion.description: Represents an emotion that a user can track in their diary.

icon.description: An emoji or other icon representing the emotion.

color.description: A color associated with the emotion (e.g., for visual representation).

description.description: A user-defined description or meaning of the emotion.

DiaryEntry.title: DiaryEntry

id.description: Unique identifier for the diary entry.

date.description: The date of the diary entry.

text.description: A textual description of the user's experience or feelings.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, DBAC, and QAPs. User profiles and emotions are stored in their own collections. Diary entries are stored in a subcollection of the user's document to enforce ownership. This structure uses path-based ownership for diary entries, simplifying security rules. No `get()` calls are needed in security rules, enabling atomic operations. The structure facilitates secure `list` operations, as each collection contains homogeneous data with consistent security requirements. The diary entries subcollection enforces a clear ownership model using hierarchical paths.
